data.title: Winter weather travel advisory in effect
meta_keywords: Environment Canada|lake effect snow|Winter weather travel advisory
data.meta_description: Lake effect snow is expected to develop late tonight and continue through Sunday
data.text:
WEATHER ALERT

ENVIRONMENT CANADA

************************

Weather advisory issued for:

Barrie - Collingwood - Hillsdale, Ont. (044130)

Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County, Ont. (046220)

Current details:

Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

Lake effect snow Sunday.

Hazards:

Snow with total accumulations of 5 to 10 cm.

Strong westerly winds gusting up to 70 km/h.

Reduced visibility in snow and blowing snow.

Timing:

Developing late tonight and continuing through Sunday.

Description:

Colder air is expected to move into the area tonight, with lake effect snow developing before morning. Northwest winds gusting up to 70 km/h will also lead to reduced visibility in blowing snow at times. Conditions are expected to improve Sunday evening.

Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather.

Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to [email protected] or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

More details on the alert are available here.

************************
